bug.author: benjohnde
bug.summary: Building Dynamic Framework on iOS without some modules
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
OpenCV => HEAD (ece3fac) Operating System / Platform => macOS 10.12.3 (16D32) Compiler => Apple LLVM version 8.0.0 (clang-800.0.42.1)
<denchmark-h:h5>Basic description</denchmark-h>
I can not build a dynamic framework for iOS while excluding some modules. <denchmark-code>Ld /tmp/opencv3/ios/build/build-iphoneos/modules/imgcodecs/OpenCV.build/Release-iphoneos/opencv_imgcodecs.build/Objects-normal/arm64/opencv2 normal arm64 cd /tmp/opencv3/opencv export IPHONEOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=8.0 export PATH="/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneOS.platform/Developer/usr/bin:/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/usr/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin:/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_121.jdk/Contents/Home" /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/clang++ -arch arm64 -dynamiclib -isysroot /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneOS.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneOS10.2.sdk -L/tmp/opencv3/ios/build/build-iphoneos/lib/Release -F/tmp/opencv3/ios/build/build-iphoneos/lib/Release -filelist /tmp/opencv3/ios/build/build-iphoneos/modules/imgcodecs/OpenCV.build/Release-iphoneos/opencv_imgcodecs.build/Objects-normal/arm64/opencv2.LinkFileList -install_name @rpath/opencv2.framework/opencv2 -miphoneos-version-min=8.0 -dead_strip -fembed-bitcode-marker -fobjc-link-runtime -rpath @executable_path/Frameworks -rpath @loader_path/Frameworks /tmp/opencv3/ios/build/build-iphoneos/lib/Release/opencv2.framework/opencv2 /tmp/opencv3/ios/build/build-iphoneos/3rdparty/lib/Release/libzlib.a /tmp/opencv3/ios/build/build-iphoneos/3rdparty/lib/Release/liblibjpeg.a /tmp/opencv3/ios/build/build-iphoneos/3rdparty/lib/Release/liblibpng.a -framework Accelerate -framework CoreGraphics -framework QuartzCore -framework AssetsLibrary /tmp/opencv3/ios/build/build-iphoneos/lib/Release/opencv2.framework/opencv2 /tmp/opencv3/ios/build/build-iphoneos/3rdparty/lib/Release/libzlib.a -single_module -compatibility_version 3.2.0 -current_version 3.2.0 -Xlinker -dependency_info -Xlinker /tmp/opencv3/ios/build/build-iphoneos/modules/imgcodecs/OpenCV.build/Release-iphoneos/opencv_imgcodecs.build/Objects-normal/arm64/opencv2_dependency_info.dat -o /tmp/opencv3/ios/build/build-iphoneos/modules/imgcodecs/OpenCV.build/Release-iphoneos/opencv_imgcodecs.build/Objects-normal/arm64/opencv2 Undefined symbols for architecture arm64: "_cvGetMat", referenced from: _cvConvertImage in utils.o "_cvError", referenced from: _cvConvertImage in utils.o "cv::transpose(cv::_InputArray const&, cv::_OutputArray const&)", referenced from: cv::ApplyExifOrientation(cv::String const&, cv::Mat&) in loadsave.o "cv::cvarrToMat(void const*, bool, bool, int, cv::AutoBuffer<double, 136ul>*)", referenced from: cv::imread_(cv::String const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o cv::imdecode_(cv::Mat const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o _cvSaveImage in loadsave.o _cvEncodeImage in loadsave.o "cv::_InputArray::kind() const", referenced from: cv::imwrite(cv::String const&, cv::_InputArray const&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in loadsave.o cv::imdecode(cv::_InputArray const&, int) in loadsave.o cv::imdecode(cv::_InputArray const&, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o cv::imencode(cv::String const&, cv::_InputArray const&, std::__1::vector<unsigned char, std::__1::allocator<unsigned char> >&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in loadsave.o "_cvCreateImage", referenced from: cv::imread_(cv::String const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o cv::imdecode_(cv::Mat const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o "_cvGetErrStatus", referenced from: _cvConvertImage in utils.o "cv::_InputArray::getMat_(int) const", referenced from: cv::imwrite(cv::String const&, cv::_InputArray const&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in loadsave.o cv::imdecode(cv::_InputArray const&, int) in loadsave.o cv::imdecode(cv::_InputArray const&, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o cv::imencode(cv::String const&, cv::_InputArray const&, std::__1::vector<unsigned char, std::__1::allocator<unsigned char> >&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in loadsave.o "_cvCreateMat", referenced from: cv::imread_(cv::String const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o cv::imdecode_(cv::Mat const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o _cvEncodeImage in loadsave.o cv::imdecode_(cv::Mat const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o "_cvReleaseMat", referenced from: cv::imread_(cv::String const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o cv::imdecode_(cv::Mat const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o _cvConvertImage in utils.o "cv::String::deallocate()", referenced from: cv::RBaseStream::open(cv::Mat const&) in bitstrm.o cv::BaseImageDecoder::setSource(cv::String const&) in grfmt_base.o cv::BaseImageDecoder::setSource(cv::Mat const&) in grfmt_base.o cv::BaseImageEncoder::setDestination(cv::String const&) in grfmt_base.o cv::BaseImageEncoder::setDestination(std::__1::vector<unsigned char, std::__1::allocator<unsigned char> >&) in grfmt_base.o cv::BaseImageEncoder::throwOnEror() const in grfmt_base.o cv::BaseImageEncoder::~BaseImageEncoder() in grfmt_base.o ... "cv::Mat::copySize(cv::Mat const&)", referenced from: cv::Mat::operator=(cv::Mat const&) in grfmt_base.o std::__1::vector<cv::Mat, std::__1::allocator<cv::Mat> >::vector(unsigned long, cv::Mat const&) in grfmt_hdr.o cv::imreadmulti(cv::String const&, std::__1::vector<cv::Mat, std::__1::allocator<cv::Mat> >&, int) in loadsave.o cv::imwrite(cv::String const&, cv::_InputArray const&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in loadsave.o cv::imdecode(cv::_InputArray const&, int) in loadsave.o cv::imdecode(cv::_InputArray const&, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o cv::imencode(cv::String const&, cv::_InputArray const&, std::__1::vector<unsigned char, std::__1::allocator<unsigned char> >&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in loadsave.o ... "_OBJC_CLASS_$_UIImage", referenced from: objc-class-ref in ios_conversions.o "_cvConvertScale", referenced from: _cvConvertImage in utils.o "cv::error(int, cv::String const&, char const*, char const*, int)", referenced from: cv::RBaseStream::open(cv::Mat const&) in bitstrm.o cv::BaseImageEncoder::throwOnEror() const in grfmt_base.o cv::HdrEncoder::write(cv::Mat const&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in grfmt_hdr.o cv::PngDecoder::readDataFromBuf(void*, unsigned char*, unsigned long) in grfmt_png.o cv::PngEncoder::writeDataToBuf(void*, unsigned char*, unsigned long) in grfmt_png.o cv::imwrite_(cv::String const&, cv::Mat const&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&, bool) in loadsave.o cv::imdecode_(cv::Mat const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o ... "cv::merge(cv::_InputArray const&, cv::_OutputArray const&)", referenced from: cv::HdrEncoder::write(cv::Mat const&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in grfmt_hdr.o "cv::Mat::create(int, int const*, int)", referenced from: cv::HdrDecoder::readData(cv::Mat&) in grfmt_hdr.o cv::imread_(cv::String const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o cv::imreadmulti(cv::String const&, std::__1::vector<cv::Mat, std::__1::allocator<cv::Mat> >&, int) in loadsave.o cv::imdecode_(cv::Mat const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o "cv::fastFree(void*)", referenced from: cv::BaseImageDecoder::~BaseImageDecoder() in grfmt_base.o cv::HdrDecoder::readData(cv::Mat&) in grfmt_hdr.o cv::HdrEncoder::write(cv::Mat const&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in grfmt_hdr.o std::__1::__vector_base<cv::Mat, std::__1::allocator<cv::Mat> >::~__vector_base() in grfmt_hdr.o cv::imread(cv::String const&, int) in loadsave.o cv::imread_(cv::String const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o cv::imreadmulti(cv::String const&, std::__1::vector<cv::Mat, std::__1::allocator<cv::Mat> >&, int) in loadsave.o ... "cv::Mat::convertTo(cv::_OutputArray const&, int, double, double) const", referenced from: cv::HdrDecoder::readData(cv::Mat&) in grfmt_hdr.o cv::HdrEncoder::write(cv::Mat const&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in grfmt_hdr.o cv::imwrite_(cv::String const&, cv::Mat const&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&, bool) in loadsave.o cv::imencode(cv::String const&, cv::_InputArray const&, std::__1::vector<unsigned char, std::__1::allocator<unsigned char> >&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in loadsave.o "cv::Mat::deallocate()", referenced from: cv::BaseImageDecoder::setSource(cv::String const&) in grfmt_base.o cv::Mat::operator=(cv::Mat const&) in grfmt_base.o cv::BaseImageDecoder::~BaseImageDecoder() in grfmt_base.o cv::HdrDecoder::readData(cv::Mat&) in grfmt_hdr.o cv::HdrEncoder::write(cv::Mat const&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in grfmt_hdr.o std::__1::__vector_base<cv::Mat, std::__1::allocator<cv::Mat> >::~__vector_base() in grfmt_hdr.o cv::imread(cv::String const&, int) in loadsave.o ... "_cvFlip", referenced from: _cvConvertImage in utils.o "cv::Mat::copyTo(cv::_OutputArray const&) const", referenced from: cv::HdrEncoder::write(cv::Mat const&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in grfmt_hdr.o "cv::tempfile(char const*)", referenced from: cv::imdecode_(cv::Mat const&, int, int, cv::Mat*) in loadsave.o cv::imencode(cv::String const&, cv::_InputArray const&, std::__1::vector<unsigned char, std::__1::allocator<unsigned char> >&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in loadsave.o "cv::flip(cv::_InputArray const&, cv::_OutputArray const&, int)", referenced from: cv::ApplyExifOrientation(cv::String const&, cv::Mat&) in loadsave.o cv::imwrite_(cv::String const&, cv::Mat const&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&, bool) in loadsave.o _cvEncodeImage in loadsave.o "cv::String::allocate(unsigned long)", referenced from: cv::RBaseStream::open(cv::Mat const&) in bitstrm.o cv::BaseImageEncoder::throwOnEror() const in grfmt_base.o cv::BmpDecoder::BmpDecoder() in grfmt_bmp.o cv::BmpEncoder::BmpEncoder() in grfmt_bmp.o cv::HdrDecoder::HdrDecoder() in grfmt_hdr.o cv::HdrEncoder::HdrEncoder() in grfmt_hdr.o cv::HdrEncoder::write(cv::Mat const&, std::__1::vector<int, std::__1::allocator<int> > const&) in grfmt_hdr.o ... ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture arm64 clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
** BUILD FAILED **
The following build commands failed: Ld /tmp/opencv3/ios/build/build-iphoneos/modules/imgcodecs/OpenCV.build/Release-iphoneos/opencv_imgcodecs.build/Objects-normal/arm64/opencv2 normal arm64 (1 failure) ============================================================ ERROR: Command '['xcodebuild', 'IPHONEOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=8.0', 'ONLY_ACTIVE_ARCH=NO', '-arch', 'armv7', '-arch', 'armv7s', '-arch', 'arm64', '-sdk', 'iphoneos', '-configuration', 'Release', '-parallelizeTargets', '-jobs', '4', '-target', 'ALL_BUILD', '-target', 'ALL_BUILD', 'build']' returned non-zero exit status 65 ============================================================ Traceback (most recent call last): File "opencv/platforms/ios/build_framework.py", line 112, in build self._build(outdir) File "opencv/platforms/ios/build_framework.py", line 104, in _build self.buildOne(t[0], t[1], mainBD, cmake_flags) File "opencv/platforms/ios/build_framework.py", line 204, in buildOne execute(buildcmd + ["-target", "ALL_BUILD", "build"], cwd = builddir) File "opencv/platforms/ios/build_framework.py", line 36, in execute retcode = check_call(cmd, cwd = cwd) File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 540, in check_call raise CalledProcessError(retcode, cmd) CalledProcessError: Command '['xcodebuild', 'IPHONEOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=8.0', 'ONLY_ACTIVE_ARCH=NO', '-arch', 'armv7', '-arch', 'armv7s', '-arch', 'arm64', '-sdk', 'iphoneos', '-configuration', 'Release', '-parallelizeTargets', '-jobs', '4', '-target', 'ALL_BUILD', '-target', 'ALL_BUILD', 'build']' returned non-zero exit status 65
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
Building OpenCV as dynamic framework w/o excluding any modules at all works perfectly. I deep dived into <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/7358>#7358</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/8009>#8009</denchmark-link> but could not find a reason for this behaviour. Maybe <denchmark-link:https://github.com/alalek>@alalek</denchmark-link> can help out here. Thanks in advance! Cheers! <denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
git clone git@github.com:opencv/opencv.git git checkout ece3fac # which is as of now the current HEAD <denchmark-h:h3>does not work at all</denchmark-h>
python opencv/platforms/ios/build_framework.py ios \ --dynamic \ --without video --without videoio --without videostab \ --without features2d --without objdetect --without flann --without ml \ --without cudaarithm --without cudabgsegm --without cudacodec --without cudafeatures2d \ --without cudafilters --without cudaimgproc --without cudalegacy --without cudaobjdetect \ --without cudaoptflow --without cudastereo --without cudawarping --without cudev \ --without highgui --without viz \ --without superres --without photo <denchmark-h:h3>works</denchmark-h>
Leaving out the dynamic parameter leads to a successful build. python opencv/platforms/ios/build_framework.py ios \ --without video --without videoio --without videostab \ --without features2d --without objdetect --without flann --without ml \ --without cudaarithm --without cudabgsegm --without cudacodec --without cudafeatures2d \ --without cudafilters --without cudaimgproc --without cudalegacy --without cudaobjdetect \ --without cudaoptflow --without cudastereo --without cudawarping --without cudev \ --without highgui --without viz \ --without superres --without photo

comments.comment:
More details are required:
CMake stdout files from build folder: CMakeCache.txt and CMakeVars.txt (as attachments)
Check, brewing a fresh build and providing the files within a snap. By "Cmake stdout" you mean the complete output, not only the last few lines like the above "Error Log"?
Lines related to CMake command run and CMake parameters. All lines before these lines: <denchmark-code>-- Configuring done -- Generating done </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/files/747812/CMake.log.txt>CMake.log.txt</denchmark-link>
EDIT Ah sry, uploaded the whole file before I read your post.

Thank you for updates! Could you try to remove this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/blob/ece3fac7efb07bf01a7875d82be51a69c0d8a1c2/platforms/ios/build_framework.py#L146>line</denchmark-link> and check again?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/files/747894/CMake.log.txt>CMake.log.txt</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/files/747896/CMakeCache.txt>CMakeCache.txt</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/files/747897/CMakeVars.txt>CMakeVars.txt</denchmark-link>
Still not working, seems like needs and some other frameworks because of . Maybe some dark voodoo like in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/blob/master/modules/videoio/CMakeLists.txt#L212>here</denchmark-link> could help out?
Try to enable back highgui/videoio modules.
After re-enabling back those two modules, I missed to clean the build folder ü§î . Worked like a charm üëç . Thanks a lot!
